instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Won't stay off.
threads.message:
If I turn it off in software, it turns back on again two or three seconds later.

Hold the power button down for 10 seconds and it stays off.

Sometimes (but seldom) it won't turn on. <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> seems to stay steady during all of this at 3.4v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Won't stay off.
threads.message:
If I let it boot then close the lid, the fan never stops.

So it seems to never go to sleep, but the display does switch off

Edit: It did sleep. Just took over 5 minutes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Won't stay off.
threads.message: So if the display shuts off, the lid sensor is working so we don't have to look there. My guess is something wrong with <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> or the SMC. Maybe even a leaking cap on <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> somewhere. Did this have liquid? If so, where.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Won't stay off.
threads.message: Also, have you tried with a known good trackpad and trackpad cable? That can cause it too sometimes

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Won't stay off.
threads.message:
No liquid damage, just wouldn't turn on. But it was quite dirty.

Thanks for your help.

I haven't tried with a known good TP and KB, will disconnect them for now.

It actually doesn't sleep when I shut the lid. It spins for awhile then turns off completely.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Won't stay off.
threads.message: Disconnect the trackpad and hit the power pads and shut it down from software. Does it do the same thing?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Won't stay off.
threads.message:
Doesn't seem to turn back on with the trackpad and keyboard disconnected.

But it won't sleep still. Will investigate the behaviour a little further quickly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Won't stay off.
threads.message: SMC LID voltage is changing when you open and close the lid right? Maybe something in settings telling it not to sleep when the lid is closed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Won't stay off.
threads.message: Nevermind, nothing in settings that would cause that..
